en_title: Secretary for Justice to visit Shanghai and Beijing
zh_title: 律政司司長訪問上海和北京

en: The Secretary for Justice, Mr Rimsky Yuen, SC, will visit Shanghai and Beijing from tomorrow (November 19) to November 21.

While in Shanghai on November 19 and 20, in addition to an event to be held by the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre, Mr Yuen will attend a seminar on legal services under the "Belt and Road" initiative co-organised by the Hong Kong Bar Association, the Shanghai Bar Association, the Shanghai International Economic and Trade Arbitration Commission, the East China University of Political Science and Law and the Shanghai Corporate Counsel Association. He will also meet with officials of the Shanghai Municipal Government and the Shanghai Bureau of Justice.

During the stay in Beijing on November 21, Mr Yuen will be joined by the Secretary for Transport and Housing, Professor Anthony Cheung Bing-leung, and other government officials to meet with officials of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council to exchange views on matters concerning co-location arrangements at the Hong Kong Section of the Guangzhou-Shenzhen-Hong Kong Express Rail Link.
Mr Yuen will return to Hong Kong in the evening on the same day.
zh: 律政司司長袁國強資深大律師明日（十一月十九日）至十一月二十一日訪問上海和北京。
在十一月十九日至二十日於上海期間，袁國強將出席由香港國際仲裁中心舉辦的活動，以及一個討論「一帶一路」相關法律服務的論壇，該論壇由香港大律師公會、上海市律師協會、上海國際經濟貿易仲裁委員會、華東政法大學和上海市企業法律顧問協會合辦。他亦會與上海巿政府和上海巿司法局官員會面。
在十一月二十一日於北京期間，袁國強將聯同運輸及房屋局局長張炳良教授及其他政府官員與國務院港澳事務辦公室官員會面，就廣深港高速鐵路香港段「一地兩檢」相關事宜交換意見。袁國強當日晚上返港。

en: The Secretary for Justice, Mr Rimsky Yuen, SC, will visit Shanghai and Beijing from tomorrow (November 19) to November 21.

While in Shanghai on November 19 and 20, in addition to an event to be held by the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre, Mr Yuen will attend a seminar on legal services under the "Belt and Road" initiative co-organised by the Hong Kong Bar Association, the Shanghai Bar Association, the Shanghai International Economic and Trade Arbitration Commission, the East China University of Political Science and Law and the Shanghai Corporate Counsel Association
He will also meet with officials of the Shanghai Municipal Government and the Shanghai Bureau of Justice.

During the stay in Beijing on November 21, Mr Yuen will be joined by the Secretary for Transport and Housing, Professor Anthony Cheung Bing-leung, and other government officials to meet with officials of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council to exchange views on matters concerning co-location arrangements at the Hong Kong Section of the Guangzhou-Shenzhen-Hong Kong Express Rail Link.
Mr Yuen will return to Hong Kong in the evening on the same day.
